page.title: 02FARMING-METHODS-TYPES
page.content: {ARABLE FARMING}The main local crops are rape,barley,spring and winter wheat,oats,potatoes and brassicas. The farms vary from 150 to 300 acres. Some are owned by individual farmers and others by major companies. {ANIMAL HUSBANDRY}Some farms also breed and fatten animals. It is said that there are more pigs than there are humans in Holderness.Other animals reared include bullocks for meat, and sheep for meat and wool. {BREEDS}The cattle include Friesians and Limousines. The sheep include Suffolks and Border Leicesters. The pigs are Landrace and Large Whites. {MACHINERY}Farm Machinery is getting larger and larger each year with huge tractors and combined harvesters being used. Past farmers used horse ploughs, hand reapers and threshers and the unique East Riding Waggon.
